channel.title: Swine flu spreads panic in Mexico City
channel.description:
Mexico City has become the epicenter of the sickness, which is suspected to have infected 1,324 people nationwide by Saturday night. Mexican President Felipe Calderón issued a decree allowing the federal health department to enter homes and forcibly quarantine people, and the authorities ordered all schools closed until May 6 in the capital and neighboring Mexico State... ...Health Secretary Jose Córdova said 81 deaths were "probably linked" to the virus, up from 68 on Friday night. However, the number of confirmed deaths from the disease had held steady at 20, he told reporters at a news conference.
[img]http://www.cbc.ca/gfx/images/news/photos/2009/04/25/mexico-flu-cp-6611697-wide.jpg[/img] http://www.usatoday.com/news/world/2009-04-25-mexicocity-flu_N.htm Like someone on /b/ said, "hooray for the collapse of civilization!"

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Efilite, post:27, topic:275775”][quote author=Greg the Xeno link=topic=364293.msg2770822#msg2770822 date=1241119545]

Strange how it all come from pigs.

Actually they never linked it to pigs. A mexican farmer had the first case of it and there is no solid evidence it came from pigs.

[/quote]
I actually eared that over the ITV news website.[/quote]

It isn’t proved that it comes from pigs. It’s called Mexican flu.

item.title: Swine flu spreads panic in Mexico City
item.dc:creator: @Efilite Efilite
item.description:
@Efilite wrote:

Strange how it all come from pigs.
Anyway, there have been a lot of adverts of TV and even over the web. But there’s no need to panic news papers try to make it sound dramatic, when only a few people in the world have it. Sooner or later it will die out.

On the other hand, I can’t back up what I have just said, theres no proof that it will spread. For instance, with bird flu, there was panic but no adverts.

Read full topic
item.source: Swine flu spreads panic in Mexico City

item.title: Swine flu spreads panic in Mexico City
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:23, topic:275775”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=364293.msg2769400#msg2769400 date=1241032378]

Its in northern minnesota. Its not that deadly anyways, people die from the common flu every year. Remember the “bird” flu?

This flu is spreading from person to person, and the bird flu wasn’t.

This will in worst case only be 15 times more deathly then normal flu.(It may kill 15 times more than normal flu does on one year)

So no need to worry.
[/quote]

so how many people died of bird flu? x15?[/quote]
I was talking about swine flue, don’t know about bird flu, but that never became pandemic.

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:7, topic:275775”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=364293.msg2766552#msg2766552 date=1240851701]
It have come to Europe, now its just waiting for EU to fall.
[/quote]

Huh? WTF are you talking about?

Anyways, it all sounds serious, but the WHO and other organizations/governments are doing everything needed to prevent a big pandemic. Mexico is just a cheap ass country, US citizens, and especially European citizens, won’t die. We have vaccines before we die.[/quote]

Vaccines don’t help you after you get it, and if it changes too often vaccines would be useless.

mexican zombies!
